channel.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
channel.description:
The Smithsonian American Art Museum will be hosting an Art of Video Games Exhibit from March 16th to September 30th, and is asking gamers to vote for their favorite games which will be displayed at the exhibit. [quote] The Art of Video Games exhibition will explore the 40-year evolution of video games as an artistic medium, with a focus on striking visual effects, the creative use of new technologies, and the most influential artists and designers. We want you to help us select the eighty video games that will be represented in the exhibition. Remember, this is an art exhibition, so be sure to vote for games that you think are visually spectacular or boast innovative design! [/quote] The categories are split into eras, which are split into gaming platforms that each have 16 to choose from. You should all go and vote! Should be interesting to see the results.
Voting takes place at [url]https://www.artofvideogames.org/[/url]

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
xalener:

Gartbartin is now playing: Modern Warfare 2

Xalener: What the fuck are you doing?

Garthbartin: LOLOLOL U PLAY HALO

Xalener: Maybe I like playing multiplayer games that have thought put into balance and whose community doesn’t thrive on getting a fucking number higher.

Garthbartin: LOL TEH FAMAS IZ TEH PWN AN U START WIT IT SO ITS BALANCED

[COLOR=‘Red’]Lies! This conversation is obviously a fraud, m16 IS WAY MORE TEH PWNS THAN THE FAMAS. Also, I like Halo, just not Halo Reach or ODST.

You were trying to chew me out when you didn’t know what the fuck I was saying.

I didn’t understand what you were saying because you didn’t know what you were talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
bigfan421:

Wait, how does one make a Subscription-based PC game (world of Warcrap) playable at a public Museum?

I bet Blizzard would be willing to give away the server software for something like this. Maybe even send a tech to DC to set it up and monitor it until it’s taken down. They would also probably have it set up like one of their test servers usually are, you make a character, and they’re max level with a bunch of good items.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
garthbartin:

CoD sucks ass. Admit it. Bush won the elctions in America TWICE, does that mean he was a good president? No, he was a fucking dumbass. It just means the voters are retarded. It’s the same with CoD. It outsells everything but not because it’s better, but because the customers are retards.

Any CoD game in itself is a decent game, but they are all so incredibly similar that it’s really not worth playing any more than just one.

Well then we are lucky we have people like you to let most of the gaming populace know they are idiots.

You are such a goddamn hipster.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
The games Pac-Man, Super Mario Brothers, The Secret of Monkey Island, Myst, and World of Warcraft, will be in the exhibit regardless of votes, and will be available for museum patrons to play.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Winged One:

@thread: Yeah, guys, fuck COD and Halo. Just because they were massively popular and sold more copies than most other series…well, they can’t be good at all. Or even influential.

CoD sucks ass. Admit it. Bush won the elctions in America TWICE, does that mean he was a good president? No, he was a fucking dumbass. It just means the voters are retarded. It’s the same with CoD. It outsells everything but not because it’s better, but because the customers are retards.

Any CoD game in itself is a decent game, but they are all so incredibly similar that it’s really not worth playing any more than just one.

xalener:

How could I possibly have known? The voting was down when I made that first post.

Well you were attempting to chew me out over something when really you just misunderstood the voting system.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
xalener:

You’re trying REALLY fucking hard to not understand what I’m saying eh?

Either way the divisions aren’t split the way I thought it would be so I can’t nominate Halo for visual effects.

Anyway, psyconauts for 05. Fuck yeah.

So maybe YOU were mistaken?

Acristoff:

And the corruption has spread to our forums, more than it already has. Great.

I’m really sorry. I know there is nothing more obnoxious than “u mad?” but it fit so perfectly I had to use it. Generally I avoid posting 4chanian stupidity as much as possible. And you’re wrong; it was never just the newbies, it started with the regulars and then made its way down the ranks.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithsonian Art of Video Games Exhibit
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
garthbartin:

u mad? So you are saying a game is beautiful because actions that exist for only a split second are really good? That’s a pretty minor detail. It’s kind of like saying a fat chick is hot because she has a big boobs; you gotta look at the big picture.

You’re trying REALLY fucking hard to not understand what I’m saying eh?

Either way the divisions aren’t split the way I thought it would be so I can’t nominate Halo for visual effects.

Anyway, psyconauts for 05. Fuck yeah.
